Can be used to save and load states. Declaration public string levelSeed Field Value Type Description System.String Remarks The seed format is defined by four sections of 7-10 numbers, divided by a dash (-). Example seed: 2885257376-2099986581-1044521005-723764510 minLevelSize Declaration public int minLevelSize Field Value Type Description System.Int32 roomTemplates Declaration public List<GridRoom> roomTemplates Field Value Type Description System.Collections.Generic.List < GridRoom > Methods ClearLevel() Destroys the current level completely with all of the instantiated GridRoom s. Declaration public void ClearLevel() Remarks The levelSeed will not be deleted, but will be replaced once a new level is generated. GenerateLevelFromSeed() Generates a Level from the current levelSeed If the seed is invalid it will generate a new level. Declaration public void GenerateLevelFromSeed() See Also levelSeed GenerateNewLevel() GenerateNewLevel() Generates a new level. Declaration public void GenerateNewLevel() GetSeed() Returns the levelSeed of the last generated level. Declaration public string GetSeed() Returns Type Description System.String levelSeed string See Also levelSeed SetSeed(String) SetSeed(String) Sets the levelSeed for the GridLevelGenerator . Declaration public bool SetSeed(string seed) Parameters Type Name Description System.String seed levelSeed string Returns Type Description System.Boolean true on success, false if seed is invalid See Also levelSeed GetSeed()
